titleStmt.title: An abridgment of the lawes of England, touching treasons, rebellious murthers, conspiracies, burning of houses, poysonings, and other capital offences. WIth such readings thereon as show the several wayes whereby offenders in such cases may become guilty. / by John Bridall, Esq.
titleStmt.author: Brydall, John, b. 1635?

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by John Bellinger, in Cliffords-Inne-Lane, and Tho. Dring at the Harrow at Chacery-Lane-End in Fleet-street,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
With bibliographical references in marginal notes.

place.placeName: the Harrow at Chacery-Lane-End in Fleet-street
